intro: Macphersonia myriantha, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to bloom in late spring to early summer.
